subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] I'm a new member
author: LON3_S7AR
full_text:
--0-792938498-1170796859=:82679
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

ive been out on hunts, the best advice i can give is this, shut down everything in your house, the heat/air etc tv's. At night whenits quiet sit in a room and introduce yourself, and if theres anyone here that would like to communicate. Can as them to make a noise or stop a clock, grandfather type work best, have seen one stopped by a grandmother "residing" in her sons house. The work that you will see mostly on this evp group is done at home and not for "ghost hunting" per say, rather making contact with those on the other side that are able to make contact. We have people here that are in constant contact with "groups" on the other side and relatives. Frank receives communications about events people etc as well. This is a rather broad mineded group and very evp smart.
if you need anything else or advice you can always catch me on yahoo messenger too.
amy

Frank Sumption <franks-boxes@...> wrote:                                  Welcome Lyn;
 
 I'm not sure how to advise you. Sometimes you need some kind of background 
 nosie for the spirits to make a voices out of, like running water, a fan, or 
 white noise. I have my own method I use, but I don't have anything I can 
 offer at the moment. Often it takes several attempts before you get results.
 
 FRank
 
 >From: "*Lyn* .~{}0{}~." <angels4lyn@...>
 >Reply-To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
 >To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
 >Subject: [EVP-ITC] I'm a new member
 >Date: Tue, 06 Feb 2007 18:38:04 -0000
 >
 >I'm a new member, I joined this group in hopes of learning about
 >this EVP... hopefully much like what ghost hunters do on their show.
 >I am impressed at their 'proof'.
 >
 >I live in a house...with a bit of 'unseen' activity.
 >we have only heard voices ourselves a few times...
 >
 >I have watched things 'move' in my front room many times  .... and
 >know something must be there... and was interested in this EVP...
 >I have a small tape recorder... but have not picked up anything.
 >
 >our activity comes and goes... I cant say its haunted, because it
 >does not seem as tho something is 'haunting' this house...
 >instead I think something lives here along with us.
 >something that may have been here ages ago.
 >
 >I just want proof of what we see and hear in this house .
 >  and thought learning more about EVP might help us in this quest.
 >
 >Lyn
 >san antonio texas
 >
 >
 >
 >
